item.title: For a fistful of ducats
item.description: Some notes on utility and incurance. The below is apropos of ET Jaynes’ Probability Theory, chapter 13. This is in many ways a useful and interesting book, but Jaynes was apparently no great believer in graphical illustrations. Utility functions One of the Bernoullis (Daniel, for those of us who are able to tell them apart) conceived a utility function \(u(x) \propto log(x)\) rather than \(u'(x) \propto x\), which was used at the time.
